conclusion: Analyze the process using the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
The line segment AB is parallel to the V-axis, indicating constant temperature T0.
The process from A to B is isothermal because the temperature is constant.
The work done by the gas during an isothermal expansion is given by W = nRT ln(VB/VA).
The work done by the gas is given as W = 10 J.
For an isothermal process involving an ideal gas, ΔU = 0 because internal energy depends only on temperature.
Using ΔU = Q - W and knowing ΔU = 0, we find Q = W.
Since W = 10 J, the heat absorbed by the gas Q is 10 J.
